title: (x) angular "Korner" - Burweed {Richard}
content:
Mike Yanega says you guys are the best at Type ID.   
   
I'm looking at the "Korner" words for the logo on this web site (the rest is Felt Tip Roman):   
   
 [http://kidskornerrehab.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/kidskornerrehab.com/)   
   
but I've also attached it here:   
   
 ![Korner Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/34412.jpg)

 [‹ (x) California license plate - Futura, Capone {Patricia, Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4514 "Go to previous forum topic") [National Parks signage fonts ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4515 "Go to next forum topic")
author: anonymous

comments.content: Sorry for the double post...added thank you to message but didn't realize I had already posted.

[Burweed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/www.paratype.com/astore/default.asp?restyles=yes&search=Burweed), which I was convinced came with an Adobe program, possibly ATM DeLuxe, but I don't see it on the site?

[Burweed](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/www.identifont.com/show?7TQ) is originally from the Image Club Typeface Library, which at one time was owned by Adobe. This weight of it was distributed along with a few other Image Club faces on a sampler disc included with many Adobe applications in the mid-90s. The Image Club library is now owned by [Agfa](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739/http:/www.fonts.com/fontpackages/packs_home.asp?nCo=AFMT&con=imageclub) via Getty Images via EyeWire.

You guys ARE amazing. I'd award points if I could ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104014739im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Oh, that's for us IT geeks. Font geeks should get points too though.   
   
Thank you!
